A [[block entity]] is used to store information about a block that can't be stored in the block's block states. It is stored inside the [[Chunk format|chunk data]] and [[structure file]]s.

== NBT format ==
Block entities are stored using [[NBT]] in the following format:
<div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound}}: A block entity<section begin="nbt format" />
** {{nbt|string|id}}: {{#if:{{{id|}}}|<code>{{{id}}}</code>|Block entity ID}}
** {{nbt|bool|keepPacked}}: 1 or 0 ({{cd|true|false|d=/}}) - If <code>true</code>, this is an invalid block entity, and this block is not immediately placed when a loaded chunk is loaded. If <code>false</code>, this is a normal block entity that can be immediately placed.
** {{nbt|int|x}}: X coordinate of the block entity.
** {{nbt|int|y}}: Y coordinate of the block entity.
** {{nbt|int|z}}: Z coordinate of the block entity.
** {{nbt|compound|components}}: Optional map of data components.
*** See {{slink|Data component format|List of components}}.<section end="nbt format" />
** Additional fields depending on the block entity type ({{nbt|string|id}}), see {{slink|Block entity format|Types}}
</div>
